channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What a Shutdown Could Look Like, and a ‘Healthy’ Food Fight
item.description: Plus, real estate’s trendiest mash-up: the “barndo.”

item.title: How Drug Overdose Deaths Have Plagued One Generation of Black Men for Decades
item.description: In dozens of cities, the recent rise of fentanyl has put older Black men in particular jeopardy.

item.title: Australia Targets China’s Influence With Deals in Pacific Islands
item.description: In separate agreements with Nauru, Papua New Guinea and the Solomon Islands, Australia is attempting to edge out China’s influence in the region.

item.title: Americans are on track to set another record for holiday travel, topping the bar set in 2019

item.title: MacKenzie Scott donated $2 billion to nearly 200 organizations this year—and many of her gifts were a total surprise
item.description: Scott has donated more than $19 billion total during the past five years.

item.title: After the Fed, shutdown deadline is 12.01 a.m. tonight

item.title: A Solstice of the Soul
item.description: For his next trick, your cosmic correspondent for the past quarter-century will (try to) retire.

item.title: Google’s targeted advert plans trigger concerns in the U.K. as watchdog condemns them as ‘irresponsible’
item.description: "Like all advertising technology, it must be lawfully and transparently deployed –- and if it is not, the ICO will act."
